p.s: How did Shakespeare's work found its way to Goethe's country?
As a student, I'm taking a part in an international school project called Global Shakespeare, which I found really interesting.

That's why I'm going to give you some basic information from ana German article I have found about how Shakespeare's work got known in Germany and relationship between the city Weimar and Shakespeare.
150 years ago Christoph Martin Wieland, a germanGerman translator made Shakespeare popular in Germany.
From 1762 to 1766, he tranlatedtranslated and published 22 Shakespeare's dramas and that's when Germans found about his insprationalinspirational work.
It is very surprising that before 18th century Shakespeare wasn't famous in German society.
It was because of the lack of translation in Germany.
However Christoph Martin Wieland made Shakespeare in Goethe's city Weimar well-known.
